title: Just 8 states account for half of US Covid hospitalizations
description: As experts race to mitigate the spread of Covid-19 by encouraging vaccinations and mask wearing, hospital systems in a handful of states are now straining to keep up with the surge.

title: Afghanistan's quick unraveling threatens to stain Biden's legacy
Calls for violence online similar to before January 6 Capitol attack, DHS Intel chief says
description: Online extremist rhetoric is strikingly similar to the build-up to the January 6 attack on the US Capitol, with increasing calls for violence linked to conspiracy theories and false narratives, Homeland Security Intelligence chief John Cohen said in an interview with CNN.

title: Canada announces vaccine mandate for air travel
description: Canada will require most commercial passengers traveling by air, rail or large ship to be fully vaccinated by fall.

title: China issues new guidelines for face mask wearing amid Delta outbreak
Police identify shooter in 'devastating' and rare mass shooting in England
description: At least five people have been killed and a suspect found dead after Britain's worst mass shooting in over a decade took place in Plymouth, southwest England, police have said.

title: Teacher allegedly attacked by parent over face masks on first day of school
description: An elementary school teacher in Northern California was hospitalized after being attacked by a parent during a verbal argument over the use of face masks, the district superintendent said.

title: CNN reporter enters US base captured by Taliban. See what she found
description: A former US military base is now in the hands of the Taliban as the future of Afghanistan is unclear. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports exclusively from what remains of Combat Outpost Andar in Afghanistan's Ghazni province.

title: Olympic sprinter explains her decision to flee to Poland
description: Belarusian sprinter Kristina Timanovskaya, who refused to her country's orders to return home after she refused to run in an event she hadn't trained for at Tokyo 2020, spoke out about seeking refuge in Poland and the video that made it dangerous to return to Belarus.

title: Drive-in theaters fueled Hollywood's box office last year. They could be here to stay
description: During a pandemic that upended lives, broke routines, and mothballed most forms of in-person activities, a funny thing happened in the entertainment business: The drive-in theater saved the cinema. But while it might have been dismissed as another anomaly in a year full of unusual economic blips, the renewed interest in drive-in theaters looks like it's here to stay.

title: Woman fatally shot by toddler while on Zoom work call, police say
description: A Florida woman died after being shot by her toddler while she was on a Zoom conference call, police say.

title: Canada has big decisions to make on China
description: In what Canadian officials have described as "arbitrary" decisions, Chinese courts this week have handed down a harsh sentence to Michael Spavor, accused of espionage, and upheld a death sentence for Robert Schellenberg, convicted of drug smuggling in the Asian country in 2018. The decisions come as the extradition trial of the Chinese tech giant Huawei chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou is entering its final stages in a Vancouver courtroom.

title: 'Jeopardy!' champ rises to top 3 on all-time winnings list
description: Matt Amodio has won over $500,000 and vaulted himself into the "Jeopardy!" Hall of Fame as the 3rd all-time highest winner in regular season play.

title: July was Earth's hottest month on record
description: We just experienced the hottest month, as a planet, in any of our lifetimes -- and we saw the weather extremes that resulted from it.

title: See the street art that makes this city a destination
description: Colombia's capital Bogotá has embraced street art and has been fostering urban artists like never before. Self-proclaimed neo-muralist, Ledania, delivers bright colors and stylized strokes that adorn high rise buildings, hotel lobbies and city blocks.

title: I didn't expect a Nicolas Cage movie to be the voice of this moment. I was wrong
description: Of all 2021's surprises, a movie delivering gentle, minimally violent emotional catharsis and starring Nicolas Cage has to be one of the strangest. The plot of the new movie "Pig," released on video on demand last week, sounds like a "John Wick" riff: A reclusive truffle hunter's beloved pig is stolen, and he journeys into the underbelly of the city he once called home to get her back.

title: Mars on Earth: Apply for NASA's simulated Martian mission
description: If you've ever dreamed of what it might be like to live on another world, here's your chance. Applications are now open to participate as a crew member in NASA's first one-year simulation of living on Mars.

title: An anonymous hacker stole $600 million in cryptocurrency, then gave it back
description: An anonymous hacker who stole more than $600 million from the decentralized finance platform Poly Network this week has returned virtually all of the money — and apparently turned down a half-million-dollar reward offered by the company for exposing its security vulnerability.

title: How extreme weather is making food more expensive
description: Devastating heat. Debilitating droughts. Crippling frost. Extreme weather is creating nightmares for farmers around the world -- and making food more expensive for Americans.

title: First live 'murder hornet' of 2021 spotted attacking a wasp nest in Washington
description: Entomologists in Washington state are setting up traps and urging people to be on the lookout after a "murder hornet" was spotted attacking a paper wasp nest this week near the US-Canadian border.

title: Selma Blair opens up about life with multiple sclerosis in emotional documentary trailer
description: Selma Blair believed she was "shooting the final days of (her) life" at one point during the filming of an upcoming documentary following her battle with multiple sclerosis (MS), a trailer for the movie reveals.

title: Discovery takes legal action against Poland over 'assault' on media freedom
description: Discovery has accused Poland of violating an international treaty by introducing new legislation the US company says amounts to an "assault" on media freedom and a direct attack on its business.

title: Paris Hilton, Cher and others react to latest Britney Spears news
Olympic silver medalist provisionally suspended for doping violation
description: British sprinter Chijindu Ujah, who won a silver medal in the 4x100m relay at the Tokyo Olympics last week, has been provisionally suspended for a doping violation, the Athletics Integrity Unit (AIU) announced on Thursday.

title: Lizzo and Cardi B dropped the video for 'Rumors'
description: The Rumors are true -- Lizzo and Cardi B have collaborated.

title: Central bank digital currencies are coming. The US must be prepared
description: Cryptocurrencies, like bitcoin and dogecoin, have dominated the news cycle in recent months. Meanwhile, the rise of another type of digital currency has gotten far less attention: central bank digital currencies (CBDCs).

title: 'Superman' cyclist shows off Colombia's underrated Boyacá
Piranhas and pink dolphins lure visitors to remote Lake Tarapoto
description: Pink dolphins, piranhas and black caiman. It sounds like the stuff of legend, but in fact they're the inhabitants of a protected wetlands system in the Amazon, home to thousands of rare animal species and fascinating tales of tribal gods turning men into dolphins.

title: Mexico breaks Covid record amid Delta variant surge. See what life looks like
description: Mexico crossed three million Covid-19 cases and recorded the highest number of daily cases since the start of the pandemic. The surge in cases and the danger of the Delta variant point to a worrying trend: the country's third wave could test its healthcare system as never before and be the deadliest surge yet. As of August, just over 20 percent of those eligible were fully vaccinated. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: 'That's a threat': Ex-FBI official reacts to Trump's remark about officer
description: Former FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCabe reacts to former President Trump calling for "justice" against the officer who shot and killed Capitol rioter Ashli Babbitt on January 6.

title: Hovercrafts were the future of transport, then it all went sideways
description: On October 1, 2000, the skirts of Princess Anne and Princess Margaret deflated for the final time. These two colossal SR.N4 hovercraft had shuttled vacationers and booze cruisers between the UK and France since the late 1960s. Now it was time to say au revoir.

title: Afghanistan's quick unraveling threatens to stain Biden's legacy
description:
• US nearing deal with Qatar to house thousands of Afghans who helped military
• US Embassy in Kabul tells staff to destroy sensitive materials

title: Belarus floods the European Union with migrants, taking a page out of Putin's playbook
description: Desperate, frightened and begging for help, they emerge from the darkness: a group of Yazidi migrants, lost in the forests of eastern Europe.

title: Hear stories from the border of Europe's last dictatorship
description: EU countries such as Lithuania, Latvia and Poland have accused Belarus of organizing "state-sponsored" illegal migration in retaliation to state sanctions imposed by the European Union. As the number of migrants illegally crossing the Belarus border rises, neighboring EU countries are working hard to keep their borders under control. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

title: Amazon shifts 'Lord of the Rings' production to UK from New Zealand
description: Middle-Earth is moving from New Zealand to the United Kingdom.

title: China issues new mask rules amid Delta outbreak
description:
• Just 8 states account for half of US Covid hospitalizations
• Canada announces vaccine mandate for air, rail and most marine passengers

title: Olympics to replace Japanese athlete's gold medal after mayor bites it
description: The medal-bite is a familiar photo opportunity for winning athletes at the Olympic Games.

title: $138 million transfer shows it's business as usual for EPL elite
description: It wasn't that long ago that six of the English Premier League's biggest teams -- Liverpool, Chelsea, Manchester United, Manchester City, Arsenal and Tottenham -- sparked outrage for signing up to the proposed European Super League (ESL).

title: Chinese military launches aircraft carrier clothing line
description: Aircraft carriers are kind of cool. Anybody who's ever seen "Top Gun" can attest to that.

title: MyPillow CEO's election fraud 'proof' implodes in front of a live audience in South Dakota
description: CNN's Donie O'Sullivan reports on MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell's recent symposium, where Lindell continued to make false claims of election fraud.

title: Disgraced K-pop star Seungri sentenced to three years on prostitution charges
description: Former K-pop star Seungri was sentenced to three years in jail on Thursday by a South Korean military court, more than two years after sexual assault allegations first emerged stunning the country.

title: Heavy floods hit northwest Turkey killing 17 people
description: Seventeen people were killed in flash floods in Turkey's Black Sea region on Thursday that sent water and debris cascading through streets, damaged bridges and ripped up roads in the second natural disaster to strike the country this month.

title: Second libel case against journalist Maria Ressa dismissed by Philippine court
description: A Philippine court has dismissed a libel case against Maria Ressa, a lawyer said on Thursday, one of several lawsuits filed against the journalist who says she has been targeted because of her news site's critical reports on President Rodrigo Duterte.

title: First major US city announces it will mandate proof of full vaccinations for certain indoor activities
description: San Francisco became the the first major US city to mandate proof of full vaccinations for certain indoor activities Thursday.

title: America more diverse and multiracial than ever before, new Census data shows
description: America is more diverse and more multiracial than ever before, according to new 2020 Census data released on Thursday.

title: Taliban captures two strategic cities, leaving Kabul increasingly cut off
'I'm just a parent who wanted a say': Man swarmed by anti-mask crowd after school board meeting
description: Tennessee parent Michael Miller talks about being harassed outside of a school board meeting after supporting a temporary order that requires children to wear masks at a local elementary school.
